winter_recipes.name: One-Pot "Baked" Feta Pasta
ingredients: 3 tablespoons lemon juice, or lime juice
2 teaspoons garlic, minced, or 1 teaspoon garlic powder
2 cups spinach, or fresh package of basil (.5 oz)

winter_recipes.name: Tofu Paprikash
ingredients: 2 blocks super firm tofu,  cut into 8 squares (or desired size)
4 tablespoon all purpose flour (use gluten free if needed)
½ cup coconut cream (can sub with vegan sour cream)

winter_recipes.name: Walnut Tacos
ingredients: 1/4 cup sun dried tomatoes in oil/tomato paste

winter_recipes.name: Broc & Chic Soup
ingredients: ▢ 4 cups low or no sodium vegetable broth (960g)
▢ 30 ounces cans chickpeas, drained and rinsed (2 cans or 850g)
▢ 5-6 cups broccoli florets, cut into bite size pieces (450g)

winter_recipes.name: Sweet & Sour Chick
ingredients: Starch slurry (1 tbsp cornstarch + 1-2 tbsp of water)

winter_recipes.name: Massaged Kale
ingredients: 1 Raw Beet, sliced extra fine, ideally on a mandolin (or cooked & chopped roughly)
Small Handful Macadamia Nuts, chopped small
1 cup/200g Stewed Grains & lentils [click for recipe]

winter_recipes.name: Sushi Nurish Bowl
ingredients: 2 cups cooked brown rice, sushi rice or whatever rice you prefer (slightly warm but not hot)

winter_recipes.name: Salmon Nourish Bowl
ingredients: 2 cups cooked brown rice, quinoa, or couscous

winter_recipes.name: Sheet Pan Teriyaki Tofu & Broc
ingredients: 1 block  extra firm tofu,  frozen, thawed and pressed* (1 block is 14-16oz)
1 head broccoli florets,  cut into bite size pieces (can also use the stems or save for another dish)
½ cup low sodium soy sauce (114g)
3 tablespoon brown sugar (can sub with maple syrup)
¼-1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes,  optional

winter_recipes.name: Cashew Tofu
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon salt,  more to taste
¼ teaspoon black pepper,  more to taste
½ cup water,  more as needed to thin
½ cup low sodium soy sauce
2 blocks super firm tofu,  cut into 8 squares (or desired size)
4 tablespoon all purpose flour (use gluten free if needed)
½ cup coconut cream (can sub with vegan sour cream)

winter_recipes.name: Roasted Roots
ingredients: ▢ ¼ teaspoon each Salt and pepper
▢ 1 cup uncooked brown basmati rice, rinsed
▢ 15 oz can chickpeas, drained and rinsed

winter_recipes.name: Loubia
ingredients: 1 can (15oz) canned white beans (Cannellini, Navy, Great Northern)
1 cup veggie broth (just cube if can of tomato)
can serve w/ bread or rice

winter_recipes.name: Orange Tofu
ingredients: 2 oranges,  both juiced and 1 zested (need ½ cup or 120g juice)
400g extra firm tofu, pressed, roughly broken into pieces,
¼ cup neutral oil for frying

winter_recipes.name: Miyeokguk for 1
ingredients: 2 tablespoons of authentic Korean soup soy sauce (or regular soy sauce) – adjust to your taste
3 tablespoons of perilla seed  flour (deulkkae garu)

winter_recipes.name: Gochujang Fried Tofu
ingredients: 3 tbsp Gochujang Korean red pepper paste
1 block tofu extra firm tofu, cut into bite-sized cubes
2 tbsp maple syrup or agave nectar or any syrup
1/2 tsp cinnamon optional but highly recommended

winter_recipes.name: sheetpan bibimbap
ingredients: 2 cups white rice dry short grain
4 tbsp gochujang more or less depending on preference, around 1 tbsp per serving
4 tsp roasted sesame oil more or less depending on preference, around 1 tsp per serving

winter_recipes.name: Tempeh Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 tbsp Maple syrup or agave nectar

winter_recipes.name: EZ vegan fried rice
ingredients: ⅓ cup low sodium soy sauce (75g)
▢ ¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes,  more or less to taste
▢ 4 cups day old cooked rice, white or brown (485g)

winter_recipes.name: General Tso Tofu
ingredients: 400g extra firm tofu,  frozen, then thawed, pressed, and cubed*
3 tablespoon brown sugar (can sub lime juice)
½ teaspoon red chili flakes,  optional
1 head broccoli,  steamed (edamame, bok choy, snap peas are other good alternatives)

winter_recipes.name: Vegan Chicken & Dumpling soup
ingredients: ▢ 1 cup coconut milk or favorite non-dairy milk

winter_recipes.name: Palak Paneer
ingredients: 1 (16 oz) block super-firm (high protein) tofu cut into small cubes
1" thumb fresh ginger peeled and minced or grated (about 1 tablespoon)
1-2 serrano peppers finely diced; see notes about spice level
2 small Roma tomatoes seeds removed, diced
1/2 teaspoon kashmiri chili powder optional – can sub paprika (mild) or cayenne (spicy)
1/3 cup full-fat coconut milk can sub vegan yogurt or cashew cream

winter_recipes.name: Cheesy Miso Onions
ingredients: ▢ 2 15oz cans cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
▢ 2 – 3 cups unsweetened dairy free milk use soy for more protein

winter_recipes.name: Stroganoff Rice
ingredients: 2 tablespoon vegan butter or olive oil
1 ¼ tsp arrowroot or cornstarch or 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour

winter_recipes.name: EZ Sheet pan
ingredients: Add soy sauce & olive oil & garlic powder to veggies

winter_recipes.name: EZ Cashew Tofu
ingredients: ½ cup water,  more as needed to thin
½ cup low sodium soy sauce

winter_recipes.name: For the Tofu
ingredients: 400 g block  extra firm tofu, pressed, roughly broken into pieces,
¼ cup neutral oil for frying

winter_recipes.name: for the sauce
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes,  more or less to taste
4 cups day old cooked rice, white or brown (485g)
400g extra firm tofu (airfried) w/ broc airfried
3 tablespoon brown sugar (can sub lime juice)
½ teaspoon red chili flakes,  optional
1 head broccoli,  steamed (edamame, bok choy, snap peas are other good alternatives)

winter_recipes.name: Quesadillas
ingredients: 2 cups walnuts,  soaked in boiling hot water for at least 30 minutes
½ tablespoon coconut sugar (sub with brown sugar)
⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper (add up to ¼ is spicier preferred)
½ tablespoon coconut aminos (sub with soy sauce or tamari)
14 oz block extra firm tofu,  drained, pressed, and smash into crumbles
1-2 cups vegan shredded cheese  (cheddar or Mexican preferred)

winter_recipes.name: Nappa Cabbage
ingredients: 3/4 cup Korean kimchi sea salt or flake sea salt (If you’re using a fine sea salt, reduce it to 1/2 cup)
6 to 8 oz well ripped persimmon (approximately 2 medium size), peeled
1 tbsp Korean kimchi sea salt or flake sea salt (If you’re using a fine sea salt, reduce it to 2 tsp)
3/4 cup gochugaru, Korean red pepper flakes (reduce amount to 1/3 to 1/2 cup if you like mild spicy)
8 to 10 oz Korean radish or daikon, peeled and thinly julienne
4 green onions, halves in lengthwise then cut into 1-inch long pieces
4 oz Korean mustard, thinly julienne carrot or garlic chive

winter_recipes.name: Mom's Salad Dressing
ingredients: 1 Tb  Olive oil mix + same mix

ingredients: 8 ounces dry noodles of choice such as ramen or rice noodles; see notes for options

1-3 teaspoons red pepper flakes I like to use gochugaru
3 tablespoons soy sauce sub tamari for gluten-free

4-6 tablespoons warm water to thin sauce as needed
Optional Toppings (use as many as you like)
½ cup edamame for added protein
1 cup pan-fried tofu for added protein
